title: What are the disadvantages of Dell? - Quora

response.answer_text: We’ve been Dell partners and re-sellers for over 20 years and it certainly has offered us both advantages and disadvantages: A BIG disadvantage is that Dell is a BIG operation and when things go wrong it’s easy to get caught up, even lost in their organization trying to get help.A BIG advantage is that Dell is a BIG operation and when you are inside their relatively wide support capabilities its likely that solutions to problems can be found and implemented.So, our experience is that Dell is far from perfect, but it’s products are generally of good quality and product support is organized and available even if sometimes challenging to obtain. To address the question directly some specific disadvantages include: Orientation to retail and BIG clients that sometimes leaves a small re-seller like us hanging.Policies that ignore the reality of the situation like requiring a 3rd or 4th technician’s visit before equipment, that all involved know needs to be replaced, is finally authorized to be replaced.Dis-functional online software ordering software that ironically requires more of our time in recent years than it did a decade ago.We could go on, but despite the disadvantages we remain pleased to work with and represent Dell for a list of counter-balancing reasons that are not “…the disadvantages of Dell…”

There are the normal issues with big OEMs such as proprietary system builds that make it harder to upgrade. They also tend to charge large amounts for upgrades and accessories. Though the one warning that I would mention with Dell is that you definitely get what you pay for. If you buy a cheap dell you get a cheap dell but if you spend the money they make some really good systems.
